segment.source: Select contacts
segment.target: Select contacts

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Through the Windows.ApplicationModel.Contacts namespace, you have several options for selecting contacts.
segment.target: Through the Windows.ApplicationModel.Contacts namespace, you have several options for selecting contacts.

segment.source: Here, we'll show you how to select a single contact or multiple contacts, and we'll show you how to configure the contact picker to retrieve only the contact information that your app needs.
segment.target: Here, we'll show you how to select a single contact or multiple contacts, and we'll show you how to configure the contact picker to retrieve only the contact information that your app needs.

segment.source: Set up the contact picker
segment.target: Set up the contact picker

segment.source: Create an instance of Windows.ApplicationModel.Contacts.ContactPicker and assign it to a variable.
segment.target: Create an instance of Windows.ApplicationModel.Contacts.ContactPicker and assign it to a variable.

segment.source: Set the selection mode (optional)
segment.target: Set the selection mode (optional)

segment.source: By default, the contact picker retrieves all of the available data for the contacts that the user selects.
segment.target: By default, the contact picker retrieves all of the available data for the contacts that the user selects.

segment.source: The SelectionMode property lets you configure the contact picker to retrieve only the data fields that your app needs.
segment.target: The SelectionMode property lets you configure the contact picker to retrieve only the data fields that your app needs.

segment.source: This is a more efficient way to use the contact picker if you only need a subset of the available contact data.
segment.target: This is a more efficient way to use the contact picker if you only need a subset of the available contact data.

segment.source: First, set the SelectionMode property to Fields:
segment.target: First, set the SelectionMode property to Fields:

segment.source: Then, use the desiredFieldsWithContactFieldType property to specify the fields that you want the contact picker to retrieve.
segment.target: Then, use the desiredFieldsWithContactFieldType property to specify the fields that you want the contact picker to retrieve.

segment.source: This example configures the contact picker to retrieve email addresses:
segment.target: This example configures the contact picker to retrieve email addresses:

segment.source: Launch the picker
segment.target: Launch the picker

segment.source: Use pickContactsAsync if you want the user to select one or more contacts.
segment.target: Use pickContactsAsync if you want the user to select one or more contacts.

segment.source: Process the contacts
segment.target: Process the contacts

segment.source: When the picker returns, check whether the user has selected any contacts.
segment.target: When the picker returns, check whether the user has selected any contacts.

segment.source: If so, process the contact information.
segment.target: If so, process the contact information.

segment.source: This example shows how to processes a single contact.
segment.target: This example shows how to processes a single contact.

segment.source: Here we retrieve the contact's name and copy it into a TextBlock control called OutputName.
segment.target: Here we retrieve the contact's name and copy it into a TextBlock control called OutputName.

segment.source: This example shows how to process multiple contacts.
segment.target: This example shows how to process multiple contacts.

segment.source: Complete example (single contact)
segment.target: Complete example (single contact)

segment.source: This example uses the contact picker to retrieve a single contact's name along with an email address, location or phone number.
segment.target: This example uses the contact picker to retrieve a single contact's name along with an email address, location or phone number.

segment.source: Complete example (multiple contacts)
segment.target: Complete example (multiple contacts)

segment.source: This example uses the contact picker to retrieve multiple contacts and then adds the contacts to a ListView control called .
segment.target: This example uses the contact picker to retrieve multiple contacts and then adds the contacts to a ListView control called .

segment.source: Summary and next steps
segment.target: Summary and next steps

segment.source: Now you have a basic understanding of how to use the contact picker to retrieve contact information.
segment.target: Now you have a basic understanding of how to use the contact picker to retrieve contact information.

segment.source: Download the Universal Windows app samples from GitHub to see more examples of how to use contacts and the contact picker.
segment.target: Download the Universal Windows app samples from GitHub to see more examples of how to use contacts and the contact picker.
